revision.text: {{Metaphor |Aliases= |Tags=mapping |Family=Governance metaphors |Source frame=Bully |Target frame=State leadership |Mappings= |Related metaphors= |Entailments= |Examples={{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=Will House Republicans Get Bullied into a Tax Hike By Obama? |Example.Provenance=http://www.westernjournalism.com/will-house-republicans-get-bullied-into-a-tax-hike-by-obama/ }}{{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=On the other hand, it's making him look indecisive, and as Pat said, he's being pushed around by the generals, by the Secretary of State and by others. |Example.Provenance=http://newsbusters.org/blogs/mark-finkelstein/2009/09/23/clintonista-dee-dee-obama-looks-indecisive-pushed-around-afghanist }} |Entered by=Eve |Status=in development |Investigated for=English |Relevant LUs= }}

FRAME: Bureaucracy; ROLES: Proposer; Proposal; Bureaucrats; Bureaucratic Process. An X-schema characterizes the stages of the process. At each stage, a Bureaucrat Evaluates the Proposal, and either Approves, Rejects, or Delays. Proposer’s Goal is Approval at all stages.
ISA: A Bureaucracy is an institution.
FRAME: An Institution has functions.
M4: Carrying out a function Is An action process.
M4: Actions are Motions
M4: Processes Are Motion Sequences
M4: Achieving a purpose is Reaching a destination.
M4: An institution is a building.
M4: A position in an institution is a location in a building.
ISA: A bureaucrat is someone who occupies a position in a bureaucracy.
ISA: A building is a structure with pathways.
M4: Efficiency is Minimizing resources and Maximizing speed.
ISA: A Maze is a network; Locations are Network nodes; Paths Are Network lines.
FRAME: A maze Has Confusingly intersecting paths that one tends to get lost on and where there is a low probability of reaching a destination. A maze uses more energy and is slower than a direct path.
MR4 INFERENCE: Trying to achieve a purpose in a bureaucracy is trying to reach a destination in a maze.
M4 INFERENCE: A person trying to achieve a purpose in a bureaucracy has to enter a maze.
M4 INFERENCE: Bureaucracies Are Inefficient.
M4 INFERENCE: A person trying to achieve a purpose in a bureaucracy has a low probability of achieving that purpose efficiently. |Tags=tentative |Family=Governance metaphors, Bureaucracy metaphors |Source frame=Maze |Target frame=Bureaucracy |Mappings= |Related metaphors= |Entailments= |Examples={{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=Lost in the bureaucratic maze of city's criminal justice system |Example.Provenance=http://www.stltoday.com/news/opinion/columns/the-platform/editorial-lost-in-the-bureaucratic-maze-of-city-s-criminal/article_a7d5da89-645c-5b7b-9b43-0a2332f2bc4f.html }} |Entered by=Ellen |Last reviewed by=George |Status=in development |LinkPersian=بروکراسی دالان تو در تو است |Investigated for=English |Relevant LUs= }}

revision.text: {{Metaphor |Aliases= |Comments=Cultural scope checked for Persian--Aria |Tags=tentative, |Family=Taxation metaphors, |Metaphor Type=Composed/complex |Cultural scope=Persian, American English |Source frame=Burden |Target frame=Taxation |Mappings={{Mapping |Target=tax_payer |Source=burdened_entity }}{{Mapping |Target=tax |Source=burden }} |Related metaphors={{Related metaphor |Related metaphor.Relation type=is a source subcase of |Related metaphor.Name=TAXATION IS CAUSING HARM }}{{Related metaphor |Related metaphor.Relation type=is a target subcase of |Related metaphor.Name=RESPONSIBILITIES ARE BURDENS }}{{Related metaphor |Related metaphor.Relation type=is a target subcase of |Related metaphor.Name=DIFFICULTIES IN ACTION ARE PHYSICAL BURDENS }} |Entailments={{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=(obligation of) paying taxes negatively affects the taxpayer |Entailment.Source inference=presence of burden negatively affects burdened_entity's ability to move or act }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=amount of taxes is related to degree to which taxpayer is affected |Entailment.Source inference=weight of burden is related to degree of (negative) effect; heavy burdens have more effect than lighter ones |Entailment.Type=scalar }} |Examples={{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=According to the Tax Foundation, Texas residents on average shoulder the fifth lowest tax burden compared to other residents in the 50 states. |Example.Provenance=http://www.ci.garland.tx.us/business/profile/afford/tax.asp }}{{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=The Obama campaign is taking a swipe at Mitt Romney's tax plan in a new television ad, saying it will create a "heavy load" for the middle class. |Example.Provenance=http://thehill.com/video/campaign/247159-obama-campaign-hits-romney-tax-plan-for-the-middle-class (Heavy load middle class) }}{{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=President Obama decided to target certain and specific products or services he deems unhealthy and levied heavy taxes on them. |Example.Provenance=http://usconservatives.about.com/od/economytaxes/a/A-List-Of-Barack-Obamas-First-Term-Tax-Increases.htm (Heavy taxes) }}{{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=Remember when President Obama literally laughed out loud at the idea his health-care plan would impose taxes on the middle class? |Example.Provenance=http://www.redstate.com/2013/04/02/beware-the-gun-tax/ (Impose taxes) }}{{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=The new president delivered on his tax cut promises, which, combined with a recession in 2001, caused the tax burden to fall considerably. |Example.Provenance=http://taxfoundation.org/article/tax-freedom-day-2013-april-18-five-days-later-last-year (Tax burden) }}{{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=New Taxes Burdensome for Farm and Ranch Families |Example.Provenance=http://www.fb.org/index.php?action=newsroom.news&year=2013&file=nr0305b.html (Taxes burdensome) }} |Entered by=Ellen, |Status=in development, release candidate |LinkPersian=سختی پرداخت مالیات، بار فیزیکی است |Investigated for=English }}

revision.text: {{Metaphor |Aliases={{Metaphor.Alias |Metaphor.Alias.Name=ACTIONS ARE SELF-PROPELLED MOVEMENTS |Metaphor.Alias.Provenance=PITF |Metaphor.Alias.Page no=187 }}{{Metaphor.Alias |Metaphor.Alias.Name=ACTION IS SELF-PROPELLED MOTION |Metaphor.Alias.Provenance=PITF |Metaphor.Alias.Page no=191 }} |Comments="actions are seen as movements that an agent carries out under the agent's own force" (PITF, p. 187) The current metaphor is defined for motion that involves a change in the mover's location (i.e. motion along a path). |Family=Location Event Structure Metaphor, Action is Motion metaphors, Grady Primary Metaphors, |Metaphor Level=General |Metaphor Type=Primary |Experiential basis=The correlation between performing actions and moving. |Source frame=Self propelled motion |Target frame=Action |Mappings={{Mapping |Target=actor |Source=self-mover }}{{Mapping |Target=action_x-schema |Source=self-motion_x-schema }} |Related metaphors={{Related metaphor |Related metaphor.Relation type=is a source subcase of |Related metaphor.Name=ACTION IS MOTION ALONG A PATH |Related metaphor.Description=more specific source domain }} |Entailments={{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=manner of action |Entailment.Source inference=manner of self-propelled movement |Entailment.Type=x-schema conditions |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=MANNER OF ACTION IS MANNER OF MOVEMENT }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=stage of action |Entailment.Source inference=stage of movement |Entailment.Type=x-schema stage |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=SUSPENSION OF ACTION IS THE STOPPING OF MOTION }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=rate of action |Entailment.Source inference=speed of motion |Entailment.Type=paired scales |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=SPEED OF ACTION IS SPEED OF MOVEMENT }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=impediments to action/freedom to act |Entailment.Source inference=presence/absence of conditions that affect motion |Entailment.Type=x-schema conditions |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=FREEDOM OF ACTION IS THE LACK OF IMPEDIMENTS TO MOVEMENT }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=external agents that affect action |Entailment.Source inference=external agents that affect motion |Entailment.Type=causal }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=impediments to action/freedom to act |Entailment.Source inference=presence/absence of conditions that affect motion |Entailment.Type=x-schema conditions |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=DIFFICULTIES ARE IMPEDIMENTS TO MOVEMENT }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=sequence of movements |Entailment.Source inference=sequence of actions |Entailment.Type=x-schema sequence of stages |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=SEQUENCE OF ACTIONS IS A SEQUENCE OF MOVEMENTS }} |Examples={{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=He exercised to the point of exhaustion. }}{{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=She page.title: Metaphor:PURPOSEFUL ACTION IS SELF-PROPELLED MOTION TO A DESTINATION

revision.text:
{{Metaphor |Aliases={{Metaphor.Alias |Metaphor.Alias.Name=PURPOSEFUL ACTION IS SELF-PROPELLED MOTION TO A DESTINATION |Metaphor.Alias.Provenance=PITF |Metaphor.Alias.Page no=191 }}{{Metaphor.Alias |Metaphor.Alias.Name=PURPOSEFUL ACTION IS GOAL-DIRECTED MOTION }} |Comments=This is a GENERIC IS SPECIFIC metaphor since the Self propelled purposeful motion frame incorporates the structure of the Purposeful action frame.
In general, this metaphor assumes that the 'goal' location is in some sense more desirable than the 'source' location. |Family=Location Event Structure Metaphor, LOVE IS A JOURNEY Cascade, Action is Motion metaphors, Primary Metaphors, |Metaphor Level=General |Metaphor Type=Primary, Entailed |Source frame=Self propelled motion to a destination |Target frame=Purposeful action |Mappings={{Mapping |Target=objective |Source=goal |Comment=I.e. PURPSOSES ARE DESIRED LOCATIONS: goal has binding to objective in Source domain frame, and objective is bound to Desire.desired_situation }}{{Mapping |Target=actor |Source=self-mover |Comment=self-mover has binding to actor in Source domain frame }}{{Mapping |Target=action_x-schema |Source=self-motion_x-schema }}{{Mapping |Target=action_x-schema_kind |Source=path |Comment=a.k.a., MEANS ARE PATHS }} |Related metaphors={{Related metaphor |Related metaphor.Relation type=is an entailment of |Related metaphor.Name=ACTION IS SELF-PROPELLED MOTION ALONG A PATH |Related metaphor.Description=entailed }}{{Related metaphor |Related metaphor.Relation type=is related to |Related metaphor.Name=MEANS ARE PATHS |Related metaphor.Description=(create relation type "has this as a mapping") }} |Entailments={{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=amount of progress |Entailment.Source inference=distance moved towards goal |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=AMOUNT OF PROGRESS IS AMOUNT OF DISTANCE MOVED }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=achieving a purpose |Entailment.Source inference=reaching a destination |Entailment.Type=x-schema stage |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=ACHIEVING A PURPOSE IS REACHING A DESTINATION }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=lack of purpose |Entailment.Source inference=lack of direction }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=making progress |Entailment.Source inference=forward motion toward goal |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=PROGRESS IS FORWARD MOTION ALONG A PATH }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=amount of effort it takes to perform action |Entailment.Source inference=amount of effort it takes to change location |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=EASE OF ACTION IS EASE OF MOTION ALONG A PATH }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=actor stops acting when objective is accomplished |Entailment.Source inference=mover stops moving when destination (end of path) is reached |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=END OF AN ACTION IS THE END OF A PATH }}{{Entailment |Entailment.Target entailment=another person guide action |Entailment.Source inference=another person can lead mover along path |Entailment.Entailed metaphors=GUIDED ACTION IS GUIDED MOTION ALONG A PATH }} |Examples={{Example |Example.Language=English |Example.Text=She made great strides in her dissertation.
